name: Neapolitan Pizza
instructions: Mix flour, water, salt, and yeast to form dough and let it rest for 8 hours.
Preheat the oven to the highest setting.
Stretch the dough into a thin circle.
Spread San Marzano tomatoes evenly.
Add torn mozzarella, drizzle with olive oil, and place basil leaves.
Bake in a pizza oven for 90 seconds or 7-10 minutes in a regular oven.
Serve hot and enjoy!
details: A traditional Italian pizza with San Marzano tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, and basil, baked at high temperatures.

name: Cheesy Chicken and Broccoli Pasta
instructions: Boil pasta according to package instructions.
Sauté garlic in olive oil, then add chicken and cook until golden.
Add broccoli and cook for 3-4 minutes.
Pour in heavy cream, add Parmesan cheese, and stir.
Season with salt and pepper, mix with pasta, and serve.
details: A rich and creamy pasta with chicken and broccoli, perfect for a quick meal.

name: Butter Chicken
instructions: Melt butter in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
Add garlic, ginger, and garam masala, then cook for a minute.
Add chicken cubes and cook until browned.
Stir in tomato puree and simmer for 15 minutes.
Pour in heavy cream and cook for another 5 minutes.
Serve hot with rice or naan.
details: A popular Indian dish featuring succulent chicken cooked in a rich and creamy tomato-butter sauce, served with rice or naan.

name: Spicy Thai Basil Chicken
instructions: Heat oil in a wok and sauté garlic and red chili.
Add minced chicken and cook until browned.
Pour in soy sauce, fish sauce, and sugar, stir to combine.
Toss in Thai basil and stir-fry for 1 more minute.
Serve with jasmine rice.
details: Enjoy the bold flavors of Thai cuisine with this spicy basil chicken stir-fry.

name: Classic Margherita Pizza
instructions: Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F).
Roll out pizza dough and place on a baking sheet.
Spread tomato sauce evenly over the dough.
Tear fresh mozzarella and distribute over the pizza.
Bake for 12-15 minutes until golden and bubbly.
Top with fresh basil and drizzle with olive oil before serving.
details: A simple yet delicious classic, Margherita pizza highlights fresh ingredients and bold flavors.

name: Peking Duck
instructions: Marinate duck with soy sauce and honey, then hang it in a cool place for 24 hours.
Roast in the oven at 220°C (430°F) for 1.5 hours until skin is crispy.
Slice thinly and serve with pancakes, hoisin sauce, scallions, and cucumber.
details: A famous Beijing dish featuring crispy roast duck served with pancakes, hoisin sauce, and vegetables.

name: Classic Beef Stroganoff
instructions: Heat butter in a skillet and sauté onions until soft.
Add beef slices and cook until browned.
Stir in mushrooms and cook for 3 minutes.
Sprinkle flour, then pour in beef broth, stirring continuously.
Simmer until thickened, then mix in sour cream.
Serve hot over egg noodles.
details: A rich and creamy Russian dish featuring tender beef slices in a savory mushroom and sour cream sauce.

name: Chicken Alfredo Pasta
instructions: Cook fettuccine pasta according to package instructions.
In a skillet, heat butter and sauté garlic until fragrant.
Add chicken slices and cook until golden brown.
Pour in heavy cream and stir in Parmesan cheese.
Simmer until the sauce thickens, then toss in cooked pasta.
Serve hot, garnished with extra Parmesan.
details: A creamy and rich Italian pasta dish with tender chicken and a luscious Alfredo sauce.

name: Sushi (Maki Rolls)
instructions: Cook and season sushi rice.
Spread rice on nori, add salmon and cucumber.
Roll tightly, slice, and serve with soy sauce.
details: A traditional Japanese dish featuring rice and seafood wrapped in seaweed.

name: Tacos al Pastor
instructions: Soak dried guajillo chilies in warm water for 10 minutes, then blend with pineapple, vinegar, garlic, achiote paste, orange juice, cumin, oregano, and salt to form a marinade.
Marinate thinly sliced pork in the mixture for at least 4 hours (preferably overnight).
Grill the marinated pork on high heat until slightly charred and cooked through.
Slice the pork thinly and serve in warm corn tortillas.
Top with chopped onions, cilantro, and a squeeze of lime.
Enjoy with your favorite salsa!
details: A popular Mexican street food featuring marinated pork grilled to perfection, served in soft corn tortillas with fresh toppings.

name: Mapo Tofu
instructions: Fry garlic, ginger, and pork until browned.
Add doubanjiang, Sichuan peppercorns, and tofu.
Simmer for 10 minutes, stirring gently, and serve with rice.
details: A spicy and numbing Sichuan dish made with tofu and ground pork in a flavorful chili bean sauce.

name: Pad Thai
instructions: Cook rice noodles according to package instructions.
Sauté shrimp in a pan until pink, then set aside.
Scramble eggs in the same pan, then add cooked noodles.
Mix in fish sauce, soy sauce, and sugar.
Add shrimp, bean sprouts, and peanuts.
Serve hot with lime wedges.
details: A traditional Thai noodle dish with stir-fried rice noodles, shrimp, eggs, and peanuts, served with a tangy sauce and lime wedges.

name: Spaghetti Carbonara
instructions: Cook spaghetti until al dente.
Sauté pancetta in a pan until crispy.
In a bowl, whisk eggs with Parmesan cheese.
Drain pasta and mix with pancetta.
Remove from heat and quickly stir in egg mixture.
Serve hot with extra Parmesan and black pepper.
details: A classic Roman pasta dish with creamy egg-based sauce, pancetta, and Parmesan.

name: Shrimp Dumplings (Har Gow)
instructions: Mix shrimp with sesame oil and salt.
Make a dough with wheat starch and cornstarch, roll out thin wrappers.
Fill with shrimp mixture, steam for 8-10 minutes, and serve hot.
details: A classic Cantonese dim sum dish featuring translucent shrimp-filled dumplings.

name: Chicken Tikka Masala
instructions: Marinate chicken with yogurt, garlic, ginger, and garam masala.
Grill or cook chicken in a pan until golden brown.
Sauté onion, add tomato puree and simmer.
Stir in heavy cream and cooked chicken.
Simmer for 10 minutes and serve hot.
details: A rich and creamy Indian dish with grilled chicken in a spiced tomato-based sauce.

name: Kerala Avial
instructions: Boil vegetables with a little water and salt until tender.
Grind coconut, cumin, and green chilies to a coarse paste.
Mix with cooked vegetables, add yogurt, and simmer for 5 minutes.
Drizzle coconut oil and garnish with curry leaves.
Serve hot with steamed rice.
details: A traditional Kerala dish made with mixed vegetables, coconut, and yogurt, cooked in coconut oil.

name: Vegetable Stir-Fry
instructions: Heat sesame oil in a wok.
Sauté garlic and ginger until fragrant.
Add vegetables and stir-fry for 5 minutes.
Pour in soy sauce and stir well.
Cook for another 3-5 minutes and serve hot.
details: A colorful and nutritious vegetable stir-fry with an Asian-inspired sauce.

name: Kung Pao Chicken
instructions: Stir-fry chicken with dried chilies and garlic.
Add soy sauce and peanuts, stir-fry until cooked through.
Serve with steamed rice.
details: A spicy and slightly sweet stir-fried dish from Sichuan cuisine with chicken, chilies, and peanuts.

name: Classic Tiramisu
instructions: Whisk egg yolks and sugar until pale.
Add mascarpone and mix until smooth.
Dip ladyfingers in espresso and layer with mascarpone mixture.
Repeat layers and finish with cocoa powder.
Chill for 4 hours before serving.
details: A rich and creamy classic Italian dessert made with espresso-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone.

name: Chickpea Curry
instructions: Sauté onion and garlic in oil until soft.
Add tomato puree and cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in chickpeas, garam masala, and coconut milk.
Simmer for 20 minutes and serve with rice.
details: A hearty and flavorful Indian chickpea curry with a creamy coconut base.

name: Masala Dosa
instructions: Soak idly rice and urad dal separately for 6 hours.
Grind them together into a smooth batter, adding water as needed.
Let the batter ferment overnight (8-12 hours).
Heat a griddle and spread a ladleful of batter into a thin circle.
Drizzle oil around the edges and cook until golden brown.
Serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar.
details: A crispy, golden South Indian crepe made from fermented rice and lentil batter, typically served with chutneys and sambar.

name: Mediterranean Chickpea Salad
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a large bowl.
Toss well to mix and coat with olive oil and lemon juice.
Let sit for 10 minutes before serving to allow flavors to meld.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.
details: A refreshing and protein-rich Mediterranean salad with fresh vegetables, feta, and a light lemon dressing.

name: Baklava
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Layer phyllo dough, brushing each layer with melted butter.
Mix walnuts, sugar, and cinnamon, then sprinkle over layers.
Continue layering and finish with phyllo dough.
Bake for 40 minutes until golden brown.
Heat honey and lemon juice, then pour over warm baklava.
Let cool before serving.
details: A rich and flaky Mediterranean dessert made with layers of phyllo, nuts, and honey syrup.

name: Fish and Chips
instructions: Heat oil to 350°F (175°C).
Mix flour, baking powder, and beer to create a batter.
Dip fish fillets in batter and fry until golden brown.
Fry potato fries until crispy.
Serve hot with salt, vinegar, or tartar sauce.
details: A British classic consisting of battered and deep-fried fish served with crispy fries.

name: Sri Lankan Kottu Roti
instructions: Heat oil and sauté onions, garlic, and chicken until cooked.
Add carrots, cabbage, and beaten eggs, stir-fry for a minute.
Mix in chopped roti, soy sauce, curry powder, and pepper.
Stir-fry everything until well combined and heated through.
Serve hot with a side of curry or sambol.
details: A famous Sri Lankan street food made with chopped roti stir-fried with vegetables, eggs, and spices.

name: Shepherd’s Pie
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Sauté onions, carrots, and lamb until browned.
Stir in flour and broth, then add peas and seasonings.
Transfer to a baking dish and top with mashed potatoes.
Bake for 25 minutes until golden brown.
Serve hot.
details: A hearty British dish made with ground lamb, vegetables, and topped with creamy mashed potatoes.

name: Nihari
instructions: Heat ghee in a pot and sauté onions until golden brown.
Add beef, ginger-garlic paste, and nihari masala, then cook until browned.
Stir in yogurt and cook for a few minutes.
Pour in water, cover, and simmer for 4 hours until meat is tender.
Mix wheat flour with water to make a slurry, then stir into the nihari to thicken.
Garnish with ginger and green chilies, then serve hot with naan and lemon wedges.
details: A slow-cooked, spicy beef stew rich in flavors, traditionally served with naan or parathas. A beloved dish in Pakistani cuisine.

name: Shakshuka
instructions: Heat olive oil in a pan and sauté onions and bell pepper until soft.
Add garlic, tomatoes, tomato paste, cumin, and paprika. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Make small wells in the sauce and crack eggs into them.
Cover and cook until the eggs are set.
Season with salt and pepper, then garnish with fresh parsley.
Serve hot with crusty bread.
details: A classic Mediterranean dish of poached eggs in a spiced tomato and pepper sauce, best enjoyed with fresh bread.

name: Bisi Bele Bath
instructions: Cook rice and toor dal together until soft.
Sauté mustard seeds, curry leaves, and vegetables in ghee.
Add tamarind paste, jaggery, and Bisi Bele Bath powder.
Mix everything with the cooked rice and dal, and simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve hot with papad or raita.
details: A spicy and tangy rice dish from Karnataka, made with lentils, vegetables, tamarind, and aromatic spices.

name: Poutine
instructions: Heat oil and fry potatoes until golden and crispy. Drain excess oil.
Place fries on a plate and top with cheese curds.
Pour hot beef gravy over fries and cheese.
Serve immediately while hot and melty.
details: A Canadian comfort food classic featuring crispy fries topped with cheese curds and hot beef gravy.

name: Vegemite Toast
instructions: Toast the bread until golden brown.
Spread butter evenly on the toast.
Lightly spread Vegemite over the buttered toast.
Serve immediately.
details: A simple yet iconic Australian breakfast of buttered toast with a thin layer of Vegemite.

name: Pani Puri
instructions: Mix mashed potatoes, chickpeas, cumin powder, and black salt.
Poke a hole in each puri and stuff it with the potato mixture.
Drizzle tamarind chutney over the filling.
Dip stuffed puris in mint-coriander pani and serve immediately.
details: A popular Indian street snack made of crispy puris filled with spiced potatoes and dipped in tangy, spicy water.

name: Moussaka
instructions: Fry eggplant slices in olive oil until golden, then set aside.
Sauté onion and garlic, then add ground lamb and cook until browned.
Stir in tomatoes, tomato paste, cinnamon, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Layer eggplants and meat sauce in a baking dish.
Top with béchamel sauce and bake at 180°C (350°F) for 30 minutes.
Serve warm.
details: A Mediterranean classic with layers of fried eggplants, rich meat sauce, and creamy béchamel topping.

name: Hyderabadi Dum Biryani
instructions: Marinate chicken with yogurt, biryani masala, and ginger-garlic paste for 1 hour.
Cook basmati rice until 70% done and set aside.
Fry onions until golden brown and mix with marinated chicken.
Layer half-cooked rice over the marinated chicken, drizzle saffron milk and ghee.
Seal with dough and cook on low flame for 30 minutes (Dum method).
Serve hot with raita and salad.
details: A rich and aromatic rice dish from Hyderabad, slow-cooked with marinated chicken, saffron, and spices.

name: Baklava
ingredients: 2 cups walnuts or pistachios, finely chopped
instructions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
Layer phyllo dough sheets in a baking dish, brushing each with melted butter.
Sprinkle chopped nuts and cinnamon between every few layers.
Cut into diamond shapes and bake for 45 minutes until golden.
Prepare syrup by heating sugar, honey, water, and lemon juice until thick.
Pour syrup over hot baklava and let it absorb before serving.
details: A sweet, crispy, and nutty pastry made with layers of phyllo dough, butter, and chopped nuts, soaked in honey syrup.
